TopicTitle: How Far Can YOUR Debris Go?

Articles.Content:
Recently (5 Minutes ago) playing KSP i made a big plane. said plane fell apart upon launch. 3 hours game time later a single piece of debris has gone 47.3KM! So I ask you...

HOW FAR CAN YOUR DEBRIS GO?

Rules?

Single piece of debris (not 2 + SEPARATE pieces)

No special debris flingers (?)!

From the main body not, say, a space station at Jool with the main body at Kerbin!

I was not sure where to post this so i ended up choosing Challenges as i could kinda make it one....

Sorry if its a bit of a bad challenge, as i write this i'm have headaches and dizziness...(CERTIFIED BAD ASS)

From Morf of the community Mission Log Project!

SEE YA!
A large SRB, went from LKO to Kerbol escape, if I remember correctly. But as far as ground debris goes, 47km is great
I've had debris reach speeds that exceeded the speed of light and leave the kerbol system after a collision with the surface of kerbin, but that was last year, a few versions back.
Cool! I may build a debris flinger that goes up to, say, LKO, launches a piece of debris and then get it somewhere, say, the Mun!

One time I accidently decoupled my fully throttled up main engine through wrong staging sequence (I actually wanted to decouple an empty tank). According to MJ I had about 11000 m/s dV left, after seperating of the manned stage it should be a few thousand more.

I reverted the flight, but I think this one would have gone pretty far
I had a piece of my plane in space i accidently decoupled it and it was on and it went over 100K's and was still going (NOTICE NO CHEATS WERE USED!)
A long time ago one of my space probes exploded and the mechjeb module went on to a solar escape orbit. I suspect Karken.
